response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 8‑inch round cake pans. In a large bowl whisk together 1½ cups flour, ¾ cup cocoa powder, 1½ tsp baking powder, 1 tsp baking soda, and ½ tsp salt. Set aside.",
  "step2": "In a separate bowl, beat 1 cup sugar and ½ cup butter until light and fluffy. Add 2 eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each. Stir in 1 tsp vanilla extract and ½ cup milk until smooth.",
  "step3": "Gradually fold the dry ingredients into the wet mixture, alternating with ½ cup buttermilk. Mix until just combined; avoid over‑mixing. The batter should be thick but pourable.",
  "step4": "Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans. Tap pans gently to release air bubbles. Bake for 25‑30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cakes cool in pans 10 minutes, then transfer to wire racks.",
  "step5": "For frosting, beat ½ cup softened butter until creamy. Add 2 cups powdered sugar, ¼ cup cocoa powder, 2 tbsp milk, and 1 tsp vanilla. Beat until smooth and spreadable. If desired, add a pinch of sea salt for contrast.",
  "step6": "Place one cake layer on a serving plate, spread frosting over the top. Add second layer, then cover the entire cake with remaining frosting. Decorate with chocolate shavings or fresh berries. Chill briefly before serving to set the frosting."
}
